title: Louis Moilliet
text: Louis Moilliet (October 6, 1880 – August 24, 1962) was an artist from <a href="Switzerland">Switzerland</a> who was noted as a <a href="Painting">painter</a> and <a href="stained%20glass">stained glass</a> designer. He was lifelong friends with fellow artists <a href="Paul%20Klee">Paul Klee</a> and <a href="August%20Macke">August Macke</a>, spending time painting and traveling with them in <a href="Tunisia">Tunisia</a> 1914 and introducing Klee into the group <a href="Der%20Blaue%20Reiter">Der Blaue Reiter</a> (The Blue Rider) earlier in 1911. His expressionist painting style was closely connected with that of the <a href="Orphism%20%28art%29">Orphism</a> movement. One of his more popular works is titled "In The Circus".
